column13: Mechs+Quilboar/Demons for tier 3s. playing for tempo (bad discovers) or a win (good discovers)
Your heropower is ice block and splitting image
Good synergy with tarecgosa and gemsplitter early, macaw and cleave late
Very vulnerable and highrolly, push your advantage before it's too late
Mainly focus on your 6; it needs to be strong and directional enough to level for
Low tier strategies are deceiving; low first place rates hurt averages, so look for good "normal" gameplans
Coins are spells for naga synergy, Barov gets better when others play less tempo heavy
Playing for survival means getting to a strong midgame board: focus on winning turns 7/8/9, not turns 2/3/4
Free tempo helps with leveling, your endgame board does not need to be quilboar
Make sure there's enough battlecries on tier 1 before you choose brann
Free tempo early; Zapping enemy divine shields later is your biggest strength
Final board does not need to be elementals; don't force the heropower if the game won't give it to you
Need to have a very good reason not to 3 on 3
You can do better than this, usually don't heropower; if you do, heropower every turn
Free tempo is good, you're not forced to play for amalgam as the win condition
Shields are good, don't worry about leveling "on time"
Being flexible with your curves is key
Figure out what tavern tier you want to discover from, then dig accordingly
Trying Finley to highroll is bad; there's way too many heroes. Pick when the other options are bad
Heropower becomes useful once you have Brann
Need to have a very good reason not to 3 on 3
Stay alive to win, always focus on economy
Need to have a very good reason not to 3 on 3
Less need to focus on a full board
Demons for early deathrattles with tempo
Wants to sit on tier 5 and spam 5 drops; beasts are best
Quests want you to buy things, Kurtrus also wants to buy things
Passive heropower >> active heropower, big cleave good
Kathranatir prevents health loss, often heropower and level turns 1 and 2
Set up triples, prepare to level flexibly to save health if early rafaam curve gives bad minions
Find a gameplan that lets you buy and sell as many things as possible, completes quests easily
Eat minions with temporary buffs (spellcraft, groundshaker)
Much better at soft-forcing; very consistent 3 on 3
Needs economy starts to level fast&efficiently
Free tempo is good, you're not forced to play for Tentacle as the win condition
Playing around Mechs' shields and Murlocs' poisons is hard
Health is a resource; Quilboar and Mechs for midgame strength
Demons are good because opponents have summons to activate your heropower; Ghastly Mask
Either force triples or be willing to heropower tier 3/4 minions
Early heropower for economy and pairs/triples, don't expect to steal direction
Repeatedly freeze while going 3 on 3 to get guaranteed high tempo
Don't heropower tier 1 minions unless you have a very good reason to
Don't force rafaam curve every game; other curves are viable too (evaluate why you play each curve).
Tarecgosa; the heropower is free tempo, not direction
Don't aim left or right until you have a very good reason to
Don't be afraid to ignore the heropower earlygame (play 3 on 3 to get into a solid midgame)
Your heropower is a roll; if you wouldn't roll, don't heropower
Don't be afraid to triple early, you can always triple more later. Pilfered Lamps
Heropower makes temporary stats permanent, spellcraft is huge
Economy on tier 1, Mechs for easy strength
Heropower is good when leveling efficiently, way weaker when staying on a tier for a long time.
You do not need to force triples, Secret Sinstone gives pairs for heropower to triple
